question.text: Which of the following points were not explained by Schleiden and Schwann when they formulated their original cell theory?

options.text: All plants are composed of different kinds of cells which form the tissues of the plant
Animal cells had a thin outer layer which is today known as the 'plasma membrane'
Cells divide and new cells are formed from pre-existing cells
The presence of cell wall is a unique character of the plant cells

solution.text: Many plants were observed by Matthias Schleiden, a German botanist. He observed that all plants are made up of different types of cells that combine to form different types of tissues. Theodore Schwann,  a British zoologist, observed that various types of animal cells have a thin outer layer. It is called the plasma membrane today. He also concluded that the cell wall is a unique feature of plants. Later Rudolf Virchow added the concept of 'Omnis cellula-e cellula'. It means that cells divide and new cells are formed from pre-existing cells.
